title: TE-RME-Based Mathematical Literacy Enhancement Program for Pre-Service Mathematics Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of Basic Mathematical Content and Understanding of Secondary Curriculum, Digital Tool Utilization Skills
context.additional_context: Real-life problem-solving projects reflecting cultural contexts, with mandatory use of digital collaboration tools

learning_goals: Learners acquire the ability to design mathematics problems reflecting cultural contexts by applying the TE-RME framework.
Learners complete three or more assignments assessing numerical literacy skills using digital tools (GeoGebra, Padlet, etc.).
Learners complete and submit one mathematics lesson design plan incorporating peer feedback.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
